messages.subject: Re: Unschooling the only child
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 09/09/2001 5:37:27 PM Eastern Daylight Time, ... I have a twelve year old boy. We have never lived in a neighborhood with other kids nearby.
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 09/09/2001 5:37:27 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:


> Just doing a check - how many folx are unschooling an only child? I
> dropped a note on the message boards about this too, and then realized
> I'd really like to discuss some of the differences that other folx see.
> The big thing I see is that my son craves companionship of other kids.
> So we do sports and the local homeschool group and the local Y. What do
> other folx do?
>
>
>

I have a twelve year old boy. We have never lived in a neighborhood with
other kids nearby. We do playdates with friends from church, homeschool
groups, etc. I think he'd love to have more time with friends, but it's often
virtually impossible to arrange. He has a few very close friends, and has
never been a social animal. Mostly he's very happy with adults or by himself,
but he REALLY wishes his best friend lived with us.

Kathryn


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
